definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: So what happens in the very likely event they find more tainted products?
sentences.chinese: 那么，如果在整治中发现了更加有害的产品呢？

sentences.english: Jack subdues the suspect but realizes Hampton has been shot.
sentences.chinese: 杰克制服了嫌犯，但他发现杰西被子弹击中了。

sentences.english: His body was found in the Floor hole.
sentences.chinese: 他的躯体发现在楼栋里。

sentences.english: The water ran for hours before the leak was found.
sentences.chinese: 漏洞发现之前，水已流了数小时。

sentences.english: The insect found itself entangled in an inextricable net.
sentences.chinese: 昆虫发现自己被缠在一个逃脱不掉的罗网中。

sentences.english: They found that the higher their level of social interaction, the better their cognitive functioning.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现，社会交往越多的人认知表现越好。

sentences.english: Fortunately, the fire is discovered soon after it has started.
sentences.chinese: 幸好火势刚起就立即被发现了。

sentences.english: Consequently, you will find that almost every one owns either a watch or a clock.
sentences.chinese: 因此，你会发现几乎每个人都拥有一只表或一个钟。

sentences.english: The travellers were dismayed to find the bridge had been wash away.
sentences.chinese: 旅行者们发现桥被冲跑了，很沮丧。

sentences.english: Finding should change standard of care, which is 4 doses every 3 weeks, researchers say.
sentences.chinese: 研究员说该发现将改变每3周4次给药的治疗标准。

sentences.english: The findings are based on detailed radar measurements of ice caps on Mars.
sentences.chinese: 这些发现是基于对火星冰冠的详细雷达测定数据。

sentences.english: Scientists find that hard-working people live longer than average men and women.
sentences.chinese: 科学家们发现努力工作的人比一般的人更有生活。

sentences.english: One was the discovery by Allied troops of the German death camps.
sentences.chinese: 一个是发现由德国死亡集中营盟军部队。

sentences.english: These materials are found capable of withstanding high temperature and high pressure.
sentences.chinese: 发现这些材料能承受高温高压。

sentences.english: Boeing says it found problems in the process used to reach the decision.
sentences.chinese: 波音公司表示他在过去做出决定的过程中发现了问题。

sentences.english: Vietnam also has reported recent cases of blue ear decease ( disease ).
sentences.chinese: 越南也报告说最近发现蓝耳猪的病例。

definition: original/former/originally/formerly/at first/so, actually, as it turns out
to find out/to know/to learn about
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
to appear/to arise/to emerge/to show up
outcome/result/conclusion/in the end/as a result/to kill/to dispatch
to press charges/to file a complaint
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
